title: (14600) Montoro - 8 Lucio Domenech Martinez
description: Dead end street next to a school and a theater, very quiet. Near the bullring

title: (14600) Montoro - 3 Calle Plano de la Feria
title_short: (14600) Montoro - 3 Calle Plano de la Feria
description: Parking next to the bullring. Quiet and flat place. Very close to the A4, recommended both to visit the town, and to sleep safely if we go en route

title: (14600) Montoro - 6 Calle Juan Antonio Cervera
description: Public parking behind the bullring. We slept 2 nights there without any problem and very quiet. Nice city, worth visiting. In addition to its old town there is a circular walk through its meanders declared natural monuments.

title: (14600) Montoro - 71 Calle Bartolomé Benítez Romero
description: Big parking with good access. Next to the street but quiet at night. Shops and restaurants near.

title: (14600) Montoro - 2 Calle Cordoneros
description: Parking lot next to the bridge and the Guadalquivir river. Very quiet at night because there are few cars on the road. Good views.

title: (14600) Montoro - 215 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Place next to the path that goes next to the Guadalquivir river. Very quiet and a very good place for a morning walk. Easy access. Suitable for a motorhome or 3 vans.

title: (14640) Montoro - 415 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Parking in the beautiful city of Montoro overlooking the medieval bridge. to the highs of the Guadalquivir. A bit noisy by passers-by until 11 or two weekends and then very quiet and beautiful.

title: (14600) La Estacion - 1 Calle Pp Atalaya y el Morrón
title_short: (14600) La Estacion - 1 Calle Pp Atalaya y el Morrón
description: It is located on a dead end street that leads to a roundabout. Supermarket 300 meters. There is a hostel next door and a truck parking lot. The place is noisy but it seems safe to spend the night. Currently there is a fire station in the buildings next door.

address.street: 1 Calle Pp Atalaya y el Morrón

title: (14600) Montoro - Unnamed Road
description: Montoro cemetery parking lot. Asphalted, leveled, without noise.

title: (14600) Montoro -
description: Rest area next to the viewpoint.

title: (14640) Villa del Río -
description: This is a car park that can take around 6 motorhomes without disturbing the locals. Slight distant road noise from the highway. Quiet town with some shops. The car park is on a good level paved surface and is well lit. Behind the car park there is a river. the small building that can be seen at the entrance is a churrería, wonderful for breakfast in the sun

title: (14640) Villa del Río - 16 Carretera Madrid Cadiz
title_short: (14640) Villa del Río - 16 Carretera Madrid Cadiz
description: Small village super nice and very quiet, parking along a nice little park in the shade

title: (14630) Pedro Abad - N-IV
description: Handy stopover but very noisy due to the main road nearby.  Chemical disposal point, fresh and waste water points and outdoor urinals. The chemical waste point is rather dirty, but what can you expect from a free stopover I suppose?!  The locals use the area as a walking loop, with or without dogs. The Spanish don't seem to pick up after their dogs so be careful, however, a lady with a long handled brush and dustpan went around the following morning and swept it all up, kudos to her!

title: (14650) Bujalance - A-306
description: It is a car park with stone tables and chairs and trees that provide good shade. I have stopped to eat and it is fine for this purpose, despite not seeing signs, I would not spend the night here well, it is very close to the road and the street is somewhat uneven.

title: (14430) Adamuz - 7 Calle de los Granadillos
description: Large car park behind a school, close to all amenities. There is cafe, gas station, commerce and right next to the city center. We arrived on a Saturday night getting lost in the area. Very calm.

title: (14620) El Carpio - 31 Diseminado el Carpio
description: Area near the hermitage of San Pedro El Carpio

title: (14650) Bujalance - 6 Calle Jardines Jesús
description: Parking in a BLEOIL gas station, which has a restaurant inside, is fine.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - A-420
description: Parking bay along side of road, gravel track that was fine for our van. overlooks the reservoir below and nice and quiet at night. amazing for star gazing! no services here and limited phone service

title: (14430) Adamuz - 8 A-421
description: Picnic area a bit abandoned but usable.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - A-420
description: Quiet at the edge of an artificial lake surrounded by olive trees. Large car park slightly sloping and without shade. Ok for motorhomes. No convenience. The path does not appear on the map but the GPS point is correct.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - A-420
description: Large land site, at the edge of the water. Quiet without water or services, without shade

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: On the edge of a very rarely used gravel road. Beautiful 360° view. The driveway is a bit steep but doable. The small street that turns off is a dead end, further back there are more places.

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: Fantastic place at the observatory for migratory birds. Absolutely quiet and lonely, the view is gigantic. Access via gravel road, a bit bumpy, but no problem without all-wheel drive. No infrastructure, 4 G.

title: (14430) Adamuz - Vereda del Carpio
description: It is a crossroads of paths, paths and highways without much traffic where you can park and take an excursion through the Sierras de Adamuz and Villafranca. Path GR-48

title: (23770) Marmolejo - 8 Ronda Norte
description: Small quiet village to spend the night. Close to the highway. Space in the shade, playground for children.

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: Beautiful spot at the parking of a natural parc, with some flat spots. There are a lot of picnic tables and a little playground nearby. Please take your own trash and keep the place clean, so everyone can enjoy!

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba - 13 Calle Víctimas del Terrorismo

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba - 1 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Wide and level esplanade next to a gas station, quiet and with a store close by in the town. Ideal for those looking for a quiet place to spend the night or eat, on the way to Seville.

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba - A-421
description: Herbal parking at the edge of the river, next to a picnic area and an ornithological circuit. Right next to the motorway exit. Convenient to make a quiet stop (the highway is all the same but does not interfere too much). No ban on motorhome notified. Let's stay discreet, of course. No service. Pretty flat. Clean.

title: (23780) Lopera - 48 Avenida Andalucia

title: (23780) Lopera - 17 Calle Cuesta

name: Camping La Albolafia

description: To avoid with a dog, to protect the banging against birds for the corn was very bad for my dog, I didn't sleep almost the whole night, apart from that the camping is great

title_short: (14660) Cañete de las Torres - 25 Ronda Baena

Alcazaba de las Torres). The town is small and can be visited in one day: squares, promenade, castle, Andalusia park, streets full of flowers (Huerto del Frances), hermitages, etc.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - Autovía del Sur
description: Ok parking for a night or two. Concreet ground very level.

title_short: (14446) Venta del Charco - 16 Calle San Miguel

title: (14029) Córdoba - CH-1

title: (14029) Córdoba - CH-1
description: At the lake, be careful narrow path only for van and small motorhomes

title: (14029) Córdoba - CH-1
description: Nice spot around the dam. Easy access by a dirt road frequented by fishermen. At the end of April, the water is at 21 °. We had a bath. We preferred to leave access to the water's edge to fishermen. Several places are possible for a van. Nice site to leave cleaner after your departure.

title: (23750) Arjonilla - 2 Calle General San Martin
description:
Overnight parking area on the edge of the village.
Infrastructure for electricity, water, showers and dumping are in place but not currently available.
The village has a tourist information centre, museum, castle ruins and air raid shelter.
There is a fresh fruit and vegetable store and a small supermarket. There are also cafes and bars.
The village council are hoping to the facilities for stopping over available as soon as possible.

title: (23790) Porcuna - sn Paseo de Jesús

title: (14670) Valenzuela -

title: (23740) Andújar - 333 Calle Minguillos

title: (14029) Córdoba - Autovía del Sur
description: Station cepsa place to park and be able to sleep, very noisy since passes the A4 just next, us not pernoctemos but it is a point in which those who do not have shower can shower for 2 euros since in the area we find not more public showers.

title: (23740) Andújar -
description: Cute picnic area next to the chapel and there are a few ruins. In the middle of nature, very calm, we spent a night there without problem. Lots of room but the ground is not very flat, we found a place at the top of the hill. Correct route to reach it.

title: (14447) Azuel - 22 Calle de Bellavista
description: Viewpoint from the Cerro de los Tomillos. A great place to spend the day and night, it has several picnic tables. There are no services, electricity, water, public lighting, etc. It is reached by crossing the narrow town and going up a dirt road with a fair-bad surface.

title: (23746) Lahiguera - 6 Calle Iglesia
description: Parked for a night. Needed to be in area for training and no spots found so far, so parked here for a night. Calm, straight and safe. Few barking dogs and views over the olive fields.

title: (14350) Cerro Muriano - 4D Acera Santa Barbara
description: Quiet area to spend day and night. Trail start possibilities from here. Level.

title: (14350) Cerro Muriano -
description: Under a hermitage, pure nature, many trees that provide shade, for 1 or 2 nights, do not start a forest fire! Very dry here. In the town of Cerro Muriano they still bought food in the "native" market. I stayed here from Cáceres to Córdoba. The photo with a view is at the top of Eremita - doable with a maximum of 6 m mobile homes/vans and it is possible to turn around - to the location here 200 m below up to 7.50 m mobile home. No 4x4 needed. Some motorcyclists go through until 8 p.m. m., just move back.

title: (14029) Córdoba - 4 N-432a
description: On a slight hill between pine trees, annoying barking dogs further down near turn off the 432a, but continue up dirt tracks up hill a few hundred meters and it's quieter, next morning Guardia civil passed on their way up dirt track to look out point but didn't have a problem with us parking there :-)

title: (23657) Escañuela - 52 Avenida de Andalucía
description: ESCANUELA Small village surrounded by olive trees. No problem staying overnight or more. Small parking lot at the exit of the village. no service.

title: (14447) Azuel - 6 A-3200
description: Small parking, 2 places, concrete, lighted, very quiet. We had a peaceful night there.

name: Complejo La Mirada
title: (23748) Complejo La Mirada
description: Camping at the La look hotel. Privileged environment in front of the Sanctuary with spectacular views. Cozy family business. We went with a 7.5m motorhome, without space or maneuvering problems. Recommended 100%. near recreational areas such as Lugar Nuevo, Jabalí, Encinarejo.

title: (14014) Córdoba - 1D Calle Escritor Almeida Garret
description: Free free parking, no schedule. Ideal for the night. Descampado in the Fatima neighborhood, a good neighborhood where you can rest peacefully, next to a school and a soccer field, and with a stream behind (just outside the city, the first area as soon as you enter from the highway of Madrid) . Very good communication with the historic center (at the corner stop buses line 1 and 2, which leave you in 15-20 minutes in the center).

title: (14014) Córdoba - 5 Calle del Periodista Pedro Alvarez
title_short: (14014) Córdoba - 5 Calle del Periodista Pedro Alvarez

title: (23748) Andújar - Unnamed Road
description: Very pretty place to make a campfire. There is a lot of place to park but not much space to park the car straight for the night... in this area you can spot Iberian lynxes and otters.

title: (14014) Córdoba - 31 Calle Hermano Juan Fernández
description: Large capacity self-service laundry, cheap prices and good service

title: (14320) Estación de Obejo -
description: Nice parking lot right by a lake where you can swim and dogs are allowed. There are no prohibition signs. We stayed here for two nights and felt very comfortable. The only drawback: the military base next door practices shooting during the day, you have to be able to endure that.

title: (14010) Córdoba - 7B Pasaje Cordoba
description: Flat ground parking near the skatepark. Quiet in a busy but quiet corner

title: (14010) Córdoba - 6 Calle Poeta Antonio Gala

title: (14014) Córdoba - Calle Guarani
description: Without facilities It is fine to park and visit the city or spend a night or two at most. It is about 20 minutes from the center although there is also public transport

title: (14007) Córdoba -

title_short: (14010) Córdoba - 4 Calle Ronda de la Manca

title: (14960) Córdoba - 71 Calle Dean Francisco Xavier

title: () Córdoba -
description: This is near to the other “place in nature” marked on the map already, but if you have 4x4 continue on from the Church parking down into bottom of small valley and follow GPS for a few minutes up tricky track which requires 4x4 and good ground clearance. Spot is on ridge on edge of valley, great views, just pulled off track, very peaceful. One walker around 9am. View back to Church and across surrounding hills. Only 20 mins to central Cordoba- we used for two nights, no one there.

title: (14006) Córdoba - 2 Calle Decano Bartolome Vargas Escobar

title: (14010) Córdoba -

title_short: (14029) Camping Los Villares Sierra de Córdoba
description: Beautiful campig in a pine forest. Large plots, new and well maintained services. The campsite staff is very nice. It has a bar and a small swimming pool. In 15 minutes you are in the center of Córdoba.

title: (14011) Córdoba - 3E Calle Poeta Emilio Prados
description: Rammed earth car park. We only stayed during the day because around a lot of hlm. 2 km from the center.

title: (14850) Córdoba - 79 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Picnic area with large gravel parking lot. Apparently occasionally used by the community, some locked facilities. Absolute silence, never a car. Extensive grounds with many picnic tables, also in the grove.

title: (14004) Córdoba - 0 Calle Caballerizas Reales
description: Drinking water fountain, there are places to park just opposite, provide a jerrycan for filling.

title: (14009) Córdoba - 4 Avenida Granada
description: Laundry

title: (14850) - 91 Diseminado Diseminados
description: A place for a break / picnic well shaded under eucalyptus trees and in the middle of olive groves. Very appreciable on the arid Cordoba-Granada road. Accessible by van only as a narrow bridge to cross. not recommended for the night because not been able to check on the way to access it is public.

title: (14009) Córdoba - 21 Avenida Fray Albino
description: Online parking in a traffic area near the Roman bridge. Safe during the day because of the movement: pedestrians, police, etc. Noisy at night. Playground next door. ZONE WITHOUT VIGILES.

title: (14009) Córdoba - 8 Plaza de Andalucía
description: Nice and quiet place to park just a few motorhomes, there’s a sand floor park just behind but I’m adding the parking places in the street has they are free of charge. It’s very close to visit the Alcazar and the cathedral, you can walk there in less than 10 min. Quiet at night but noisy after 8 a.m.

title: (14011) Córdoba - 131 Calle Arqueólogo García y Bellido
title_short: (14011) Córdoba - 131 Calle Arqueólogo García y Bellido
description: Land parking very close to the center. Stick with the bus station and train station, both of which have toilets.

title: (14009) Córdoba - 3P Calle Cordel de Écija
description:
Free quiet day/night parking near the city center.
To visit the historic center, prefer to walk up the Guadalquivir on foot for 500m towards the north, then cross the Roman bridge!

title: (14004) Córdoba - A-431
description:
Parking and service area with a steep incline. 20-30 minutes walk from the world famous Mesquita and 10 minutes walk from the historic center. Super central with a large, beautiful park just above (good for joggers and dog walkers). Jacks can compensate for the gradient. Balancing with wedges is much more difficult.
The first 10 minutes are free. After that, every minute is billed. Payment is by credit card.
There is no electricity on the pitches. There is an emergency power connection at the disposal station
Danger:
1) Not suitable for vehicles over 8.50 m.
2) The place is parceled out. If you use more than one plot, you pay twice! (Furniture, trailer or wrong parking). Pay attention to the boundaries of the parcel.
3) After paying, you have 5 minutes to leave. After that you have to pay !

title: (14012) Córdoba - 12 Calle Acebuche
description: Very quiet place to rest next to a social club that closes at 1 in the morning and you can rest alone. nearby there is a Mercadona.

title: (14011) Córdoba - 1P Calle Dolores Ibárruri
description: Parking area in a park with games for children, benches, in the district which is an urbanization of calm apartments, with bars, workshops, benches. Bus stop nearby and 20 minutes from the center, or 30 minutes on foot, a street behind a Mercadona

title: (14013) Córdoba - 74 Avenida de Cádiz
description: Drinking water.

title: (14011) Córdoba - 18P Calle Juan de Gortz
description: Quiet street to park the motorhome

title: (14004) Córdoba - 1 Avenida Linneo
description:
Parking of the Botanical Garden and the Zoo of Cordoba, we spent 2 very quiet nights. 15 minutes walk from the center
The street is active from 7:30 a.m.

title: (14004) Córdoba - s/n Plaza de Vista Alegre
title_short: (14004) Córdoba - s/n Plaza de Vista Alegre
description: Local sports centre - we asked to use the showers and they let us in for free. Showers are relatively clean, and there is hot water. You push the button every 20 seconds or so for water, but temperature and pressure are good.

title: (14004) Córdoba - 4 Calle Escritor Castilla Agua
description: Parking very close to the zoo and 15 min walk from the Mezquita. Flat terrain. This is the university street.

title: (14004) Córdoba - 1 Calle Manuel de la Haba
title_short: (14004) Córdoba - 1 Calle Manuel de la Haba
description: Cemetery car park with a small entrance ideal for visiting the city and spending one of the peaceful nights there

title: (14004) Córdoba - 720 Calle Pintor Espinosa
description: Free public parking. We arrived at it accompanied by the local Cordoba police and they told us that there were no problems for spending the night in it. During the day it is controlled by an association for the disabled who give you a ticket for one euro and spend the day. Very quiet and without problems to just sleep and visit the beautiful city of Cordoba. MANY THANKS TO THE LOCAL POLICE OF CORDOBA FOR THEIR HELP.

title: (14011) Córdoba - 4 Calle Isla Madeira
description: Speed Queen laundromat. No dogs allowed, but there are two hooks in front of the door where you can park your four-legged friend.

title: (14004) Córdoba - 14 Calle Pintor Espinosa
description: Laundromat from the Speedqueen chain. Very clean and 10 minutes walk from the motorhome area (on the other side of the park). There is even a machine and a dryer reserved for animals.

title: (14005) Córdoba - Jose Maria Martorell
description: Laundry inside the shopping center, open on Saturdays and Sundays, as well as other typical services in shopping centers, including a service station with LPG and butane bottles.

title: (23730) Villanueva de la Reina - 2 Poligono UE5
title_short: (23730) Villanueva de la Reina - 2 Poligono UE5
description: Parking at the entrance to the park, street is well lit.

title: (14005) Córdoba - s/n Jose Maria Martorell
description: Repsol service station with six kilos of K6 butane cylinder

title: (14029) Córdoba - 28 CO-3405
description: Parking in grass possibility to get close to trees to be in the shade. Ideal to spend the day at the swimming pool located at 20 m. You will have a view on your campsite because the day without fears and you can sleep on the spot without worries

title: (14004) Córdoba - 25 Avenida del Aeropuerto
description: Washing with upper walkway

title: (14004) Córdoba - 14 Calle Escritor Conde de Zamora
title_short: (14004) Córdoba - 14 Calle Escritor Conde de Zamora
description: Online parking area, ideal for motorhome. 16 minutes from the mosque. A quiet place with no problem being away from the center. 2 nights without problem

title: (14440) Villanueva de Córdoba - Ronda de San José
title_short: (14440) Villanueva de Córdoba - Ronda de San José
description: Very quiet area to park during the day and spend the night except the days when they celebrate the fair Ham. Very nice village to visit and eat excellent meat Pedroches.Vous can request a tourist visit to the town hall. The tourist girl is charming and she explained the Granito road.

title: (14005) Córdoba - 6 Carretera Palma del Río
description: Lavomatic at the repsol petrol station. small bread and small things store

title: (14011) Córdoba - 1 Calle Islas Chafarinas
description: Land parking, flat and with the noise of the highway.

title: (14960) Córdoba - Carretera de las Ermitas
description: A road that ends and begins a path in the mountains towards a hiking trail, from here you have beautiful views of all of Córdoba, slope incline.

title: (14005) Córdoba - 18 Prolongacion Avenida de Manolete
description: Online parking next to a park and a Mercadona. We stayed 2 nights. There is a lot of noise from the bus line at 50m. Line 7 to get closer to the center or 25min walk

title: (14004) Córdoba - 704 Calle San Alberto Magno
description: Paid parking day and night

title: (14005) Córdoba - 23A Calle Francisco Gracia Trenas
description: A quiet, secure and calm place to stay the night, close to El Corte Inglés shopping. Residential area where it’s possible to jogging or ride a bike, also green parks nearby.

title: (14440) Villanueva de Córdoba - 20 Camino de la Plata
title_short: (14440) Villanueva de Córdoba - 20 Camino de la Plata
description: Newly opened motorhome area. Maximum stay of 72 hours. Free. Call before you come.

title: (14012) Córdoba - Carretera de las Ermitas
description: Visitors parking. beautiful views. the only drawback is the accumulated garbage in the gutters

title: (14005) Córdoba -
description: Laundromat

title: (14859) Albendín - 26 Calle Noria
description: A new area with gray water and black water emptying point and clean water filling point very very cozy quiet town

title: (14830) Espejo - 22 Calle Barriada del Cerro
description: Parking, several horizontal squares, population with Castle and monumental buildings

title: (14830) Espejo - 37 Calle Regiones Devastadas
description: To the right of the wash boxes is a water tap.

title: (23730) Villanueva de la Reina - 4 Calle Alamos
title_short: (23730) Villanueva de la Reina - 4 Calle Alamos
description: Self-service gas station, payment only by card. It is the only gas station around. Cheap with free air and water

title: (14005) Córdoba - Ctra. Palma Del Río km3,3
title_short: (14005) Córdoba - Ctra. Palma Del Río km3,3
description: Free parking, to spend the night if night falls, ample space

title: (23740) Andújar - JF-5004
description: Parking at the end of La Lancha road (gravel and potholed but drivable) famous among lynx watchers. The parking is right by the dam so expect some gentle noise at night. Good shade in the afternoon from big eucalyptus trees. The parking is quite popular during the weekends but nobody stayed overnight in March. We have a pleasant week there without problems. A nice short walk starts right from the parking - good for birdwatching and watching ibex up the rocks. For birdwatching, you can also cross the dam and walk along the road. There are turtles in the lake. If you are in this area for lynx watching this is a perfect place for a night. Just 15 minutes drive back in the direction of farms and the main road there are three lookouts to observe lynxes (if you are lucky). We saw only one during our week-long stay. Other wildlife such as red deers, fallow deers, mouflons are present. Spanish imperial eagle is possible too from the lookouts. Definitely, a perfect place for a prolonged stay, especially if you are a nature lover. The parking is spacey enough even for several big motorhomes. There are no services, no source of water and no rubbish bin. You have to be fully self-sufficient to enjoy this place.

name: Mirador del embalse del Jándula
title: (23748) Mirador del embalse del Jándula
description:
A stunning space for up to 3 vans.  A peaceful and tranquil stay immersed in nature with Eagles and Vultures flying overhead and the opportunity to spot Lnyx and Deer. 
It is at the end of a 10KM rough track but the vista is worth every bump. 
The reason why we camp offgrid.

No water or bins so you bring what you need and take home what you used. 

Popular are for fishing and wildlife spotting.

title: (14005) - 21E Calle 6 Sg
description:
One of the few places where LPG - LPG. they have all adapters!
ATTENTION for the loading of the bottles need you the bottle base adapter I could not charge my french 13kg and my Woodruff... (70km detour for nothing)
No other service

title: (14005) Córdoba - N-437
description: Corner for picnic and night near the road. The natural corners are rare here!

title: (14011) Trassierra - Unnamed Road
description: Lonely turnaround at the end of a high road overlooking Córdoba.  Room for several vehicles.  Badly paved road.  Nearest residence is far away.  It seems like the only usage is parking for a trailhead to a seldom-used trail.

title: (14005) Córdoba - CO-3314
description: The Medina azahara car park, from where the buses leave to go to the site. Ample parking. Essential visit and watch the video in the visitor center.

title: (14448) Conquista - 11 Calle Barrio Estacion
description: Free parking with a small water fountain, very quiet village, facing the municipal swimming pool. Perfect for a quiet night's sleep. Right next to a road but almost no passage (village of 400 people)

title: (14850) Baena - 1 Calle Guardia Civil
description: Esplanade stadium occupied by carnival during the holy week 2017 (April 12) we found this large parking near the high school, flat, cemented and very quiet (school holidays?) With bins and fallow land ideal for taking out the dog.

title: (23650) Torredonjimeno - JV-2121
description: Beautiful place where you can spend the night and enjoy nature and its centenary olive trees, very spacious, 100 meters from a beautiful hermitage of Our Lady of Consolation (14th century), and 2 kilometers from the town of Torredonjimeno.

title: (14850) Baena - 1 Calle Iznajar
description: Paved parking for cars. No services. At 10 minutes from the center.

title: (14859) Albendín - Unnamed Road
description: On the dam about 8 parking spaces from the Naitic Club directly on the lake. We stayed here with 2 campers. Bar with great food available. It runs the 9km off the main road to get here. Class

title: (14850) Baena - 88T Avenida Padre Villoslada
description: Parking with beautiful views of the town in a quiet neighborhood. Nearby there is a children's play area and a soccer field. Right next door there is a Carrefour with a gas station and a water outlet, as well as a car wash. It is right at the entrance of the town, close to the road.

title: (14850) Baena - 30 Calle Demetrio de los Ríos
title_short: (14850) Baena - 30 Calle Demetrio de los Ríos
description: The car park, although slightly inclined, is close to the monumental area, quiet area next to a small park.

title: (14029) Córdoba - 6 Carretera del Aeropuerto
description: Córdoba airport parking, to spend the night very quiet, no noise, no service, free Wifi Aena (civil aviation), if you park near the terminal, about 10 km from Cordoba. If you like skydiving or want to do a first flight, you can do it too.

title: (23740) Andújar - A-6178
description: Small clearing along the road without traffic (2 cars in 10h). Important presence of deer that can be observed at any time of the day. A delight.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic picnic with water fountain next to the Fuencaliente soccer field. Very quiet place

title: (14830) Espejo -
description: Fantastic place to spend the night and enjoy the countryside in the winter or spring months next to the ruins of the Montemayor castle. In the summer months better not. There is a large spring water source with a lot of history too

title: (13130) Fuencaliente -
description: Parking Shelter of Peña Escrita. Ideal to start routes and visit the cave paintings. Access is by a narrow and continuous road along an unpaved road. Note on the routes: During the high fire danger season (June 1 - September 30), access will be subject to the sectoral legislation in this regard.

title: (14850) Baena - 38 Poligono Pau
description: Picnic site. Fairly flat. Bins. Good view of town. Best access is immediately beside Lidl on the edge of village. The road is single track with no passing places for about 400m. Well above the main road so fairly quiet.

name: Área de autocaravanas automática
title: (13130) Área de autocaravanas automática
description: Automatic motorhome area. It is similar to those that exist in the community of Castilla la Mancha. You have access by credit card. The water change is paid separately and the bathrooms and toilets are also paid separately. The 14 seats are somewhat uneven but with fixing chocks. There are different routes that can be consulted on the website of the Fuencaliente town hall.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - N-420
description: Recreation area with drinking water, a stream, tables and many trees.

title: (14520) Fernán-Núñez - 18 Calle el Vivero
description: Large paved and shaded car park. No service. Very calm

title: (23614) Las Casillas -
description: Parking on the site of the former Estación Vado Jaén train station, on the route of the via verde del aceite cycle path. Large picnic area. Some road noise. No services.

title: (14857) - 499 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Picnic area with shadows, tables and playground. Very calm.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - 110 N-420
description: Roadside stop with shade

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - Camino de Ventillas
description: Pleasant place easy to access by track 8 picnic tables in the woods and fountain / source good flow almost flat area for 3/4 motorhomes ideal for dogs. Forbidden at night

title: (14880) Luque - 21 Carretera de Córdoba
description: Beautiful natural area next to the green way of oil, the natural park of the Sierra Subbética. Close to Nicol's restaurant. Bicycle route and hiking towards Jaen and towards Cabra.

title: (14880) Luque - CO-6204
description:
Parking actually for the excursion point
"Laguna del Salobral.
However, the lagoon has completely dried up. so it is rarely visited.
A very very quiet place.
In the midst of olive plantations.
No problems.

The place is right on the bike path
"Via Verde del Aceite"
This bike path is an open railway line. (olive oil train). In this area it runs through a very beautiful part of Andalusia. Over bridges and small gorges, almost flat.
Ideal for small bike tours.

title: (14880) Luque - CO-6203
description: Cemetery parking. tranquility.  Other accessible parking in the center of the village but just for the visit not to be missed.

title: (14860) Doña Mencía - CO-6202
description: Fenced picnic area along the road with some stone furniture. Good to take a break. We have not slept here but the road does not seem very busy.

title: (14870) Zuheros - 305 Poligono PP-R1
description: Municipal swimming pool campsite

name: Area Autocaravanas
title: (14860) Area Autocaravanas
description: Municipal area for motorhomes. Along the via verde del aceite cycle path, on the site of the former Estacion Doña Mencia railway station. Paid parking. Different price for one night during the week, or for the weekend, or for a week. Payment at the tourist office, no later than the day after arrival. Reservation required: Free services if the entrance barrier is open. Restaurant on site, La Cantina.

title: (14550) Montilla - 1582 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Parking of Cerro don Juan in Montilla beautiful views and a cool place in summer within what is the clear countryside. To go out by bike and visit wine presses, nearby is the white press or the Bourbons with great wines and very good views .

title: (14870) Zuheros - 125 Poligono PP-R1
description: Cemetery parking, good place to visit Zuheros, and possibility of spending the night, although it is next to the road, it is not very busy

title: (14870) Zuheros - 60 Calle Santo
description: Parking at the entrance of the village, dawn and very quiet. Nice place

title: (14870) Zuheros - CV-247
description: Parking in earth of the cave and eco museum. A bit of slope but very quiet and superb view. Possibility to visit the cave. No service. Beautiful village of Zueros 4 km.

title: (14449) El Horcajo - Cam del Robledillo a Fuencaliente
title_short: (14449) El Horcajo - Cam del Robledillo a Fuencaliente
description: Quiet place surrounded by nature No services Ideal for nature lovers and hikers Very little traffic on the road Altitude 742 meters Accessible to any size motorhome with trailer or heavy goods vehicles The Guardia Civil passes no problem

title: (14870) Zuheros - CV-247
description: On the edge of the road, but with little passage, except some cars, mountain biking, hiker and shepherd, visit the cave or walk, CC good, no service.
